row.cell: FLAT_LEGEND

race.title: Punchestown Gold Cup
race.full_title: Bibby Financial Services Ireland Punchestown Gold Cup

pedigree.generation3: Northern Dancer,Fairy Bridge,Top Ville,Toute Cy,Kalamoun,Belle of Ireland,Lord Gayle,Ceol An Oir

row.cell: pedigree

Trained in France by J-L Pelletan. Second twice in four runs as a two-year-old. Successful twice at 1 mile as a three-year-old including listed Prix Omnium at Saint-Cloud, but well beaten when tried in Group races
Bought by George Creighton and transferred to Willie Mullins
Entered in both Irish and Cheltenham Champion Hurdles.
Missed Cheltenham due to splint problem.
Entered in Group 1 Tattersalls Gold Cup over 10 furlongs in May, but given summer break to concentrate on hurdling. Ante-post favpurite for Champion Hurdle.
5 wins from 6 runs.| |3 Group One victories.
Sprained a suspensory ligament, shortly before Christmas, while being prepared for Festival Hurdle.
Ended the season second favourite (at 6/1) in ante-post list for Champion Hurdle.
6 wins from 7 runs.| |4 Group One victories.
Missed intended return in Morgiana Hurdle as trainer not happy with him, but had spin over 12 furlongs on the Flat after racing.

Speculation that Hurricane Fly would contest the Grande Course de Haies d'Auteuil over an extended three miles. Win in Hatton's Grace shows stays two and a half miles, but speed is greatest asset, so doubtful would stay three miles. Timeform wondered whether a match between Hurricane Fly and Big Buck's (over 2.5 miles) could be arranged.
11 wins from 12 runs.| |9 Group One victories.
Intended reappearances in Morgiana and then Festival Hurdles were ruled out due to unsatisfactory work.
Work improved after Christmas, and a racecourse gallop at Leopardstown in early January went well.
13 wins from 16 runs.| |11 Group One victories.
Earnings now past the million-pound mark. Hailed by Timeform as a true heir to Istabraq (23 wins from 26 completed starts).
18 wins from 21 runs.| |16 Group One victories.
For the first time in his life Hurricane Fly had suffered two consecutive defeats. Generally thought that he would be stepped up in trip next season.
21 wins from 26 runs.| |19 Group One victories.

pedigree.generation3: St Paddy,Nagaika,Sammy Davis,Leadendale Lady,Sea Hawk II,Come Dancing,Menelek,Stroll On

row.cell: 12/1 for the Gold Cup after Hennessy win.
pedigree
Withdrawn from Hennessy on morning of race (11/8 Fav, set to carry 10st 9lb) due to heavy overnight rain.
Due to run in Pillar Property Investments Chase, but race was lost to the weather.
In the absence of a suitable prep race for Cheltenham, One Man was given two racecourse gallops, including at Carlisle, 8 days before the Gold Cup.
Having started 11/8 Fav, veterinary tests found nothing untoward. Was his defeat in the Gold Cup simply due to lack of stamina?
JUMP_LEGEND
Ran over hurdles for A. Chaille-Chaille in France.

pedigree.generation3: Run The Gantlet,Le Melody,Green God,Miss Golightly,Lord Gayle,Areola,Rarity,Colourful

row.cell: Half-brother to Carruthers.
Seemingly not suited by less testing conditions at Newbury.
Went lame behind (later found to be a small stress fracture) while being prepared for Cheltenham, and stable decided too big a risk to run him.
Despite having ended early, Coneygree's first season over hurdles had been a success. Timeform described him as "a mudlark", "genuine" and a "fluent-jumping front runner".
Cut back leg when returning home from gallops and missed the whole season.
PEDIGREE
Following win in Kauto Star, connections revealed that they were considering the Gold Cup as an alternative to the RSA Chase. Nico de Boinville missed ride in Denman Chase due to suspension.
Bred in Ireland. Cleverly named after Gary Cooper's character in the the 1940 film "The Westerner", a reference to his sire, Westerner.
Foaled in April 2009. Unraced until just before his fourth birthday.
New owners, and transferred from Brian Storey to Warren Greatrex at Uplands, Lambourn.
Already a confirmed front runner.
After Cleeve Hurdle, underwent a soft palate operation to correct a breathing problem.
Bought for 52,000 as an unraced three-year-old at the 2009 Derby Sale.
Better than ever at Exeter, and bred to stay three miles, so King George seemed logical option.
Having seemingly failed to stay 3 miles in the King George, the Cheltenham options narrowed to either the Champion or Ryanair Chase.
Lots of discussion whether Cue Card would contest the Gold Cup or the Ryanair Chase, but missed both when suffered minor fracture of the pelvis two weeks before the Festival.
With Joe Tizzard having announced his retirement, Cue Card will have a new jockey, Daryl Jacob.

Trained by Alain Royer-Dupre in France. Had three runs as a 3-y-o, winning on debut over 12 furlongs, blinkered on each occasion. Gelded before first run over hurdles, which reportedly helped to make him more tractable.
Apparently stable's second string in Adonis (Paul Nicholls-trained Tonic Mellysse started favourite), and again in Triumph Hurdle when Sam Winner was market leader.
Had a breathing operation over the summer.
PEDIGREE
Betfair Hurdle run 6 days later than scheduled after snow caused postponement.

Almost missed Cheltenham due to coughing, but started third favourite for Champion Hurdle. Step up to two and half miles at Aintree was interesting, but fell too early to know whether it would suit him.
Wore blinkers, for the first time since running on the Flat in France, at Aintree.

race.title: Prix du Syndicat d'Elevage de la Nievre
Gras Savoye Risk Consulting Prix Stanley
